isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS - Circuit Function And Diagnostics - Engine Diagnostics Switch and Engine Warning Light

svcproc.title: Engine Diagnostics Switch and Engine Warning Light

svcsubproc.title: Signal Function

figure.caption: Function Diagram for Self Test Input Switch

svcsubproc.para: The STI switch (Engine Diagnostic Switch) can be used to run the Key-On Engine-Off (KOEO) Standard Tests. Diagnostic Trouble Codes detected during this test result in active Diagnostic Trouble Codes, which are transmitted as a series of flashes through the WARN ENGINE lamp. If no Diagnostic Trouble Codes are detected, the ECM will FLASH Diagnostic Trouble Code 111 (this indicates that no Diagnostic Trouble Codes have been detected).
ECM pin 34 has 5V with the key ON and engine OFF. Depressing the STI switch grounds pin 34, causing it to change from 5V to 0V, signaling the ECM to start the KOEO Standard Tests.

When the key switch is turned ON, the amber Engine Warning Lamp turns ON and stays ON, while the ECM runs normal start-up tests, and then turns OFF. If the ECM detects a problem, the WARN ENGINE lamp remains ON.

Ignition power is applied to the WARN ENGINE Lamp. The ground side of the WARN ENGINE lamp is connected to ECM pin 55, which is a ground switch. The ECM applies 5V to pin 55 (light OFF) or 0V (light ON), in response to engine conditions.

svcsubproc.title: Fault Detection / Management
svcsubproc.para: The ECM can detect an open WARN ENGINE Lamp circuit during a Standard Engine Off test when an output circuit test is automatically performed. There are no ECM diagnostics for the STI circuits.

figure.caption: Circuit Diagram for Self Test Input Switch and Engine Warning Light

table.title: Diagnostics for Self Test Input Switch and Engine Warning Light

para.emph: Test STI Switch with Ignition Key OFF
Test at STI Switch Connection with Ignition Key OFF

entry.para: < than 1000 Ω locate short to ground.

para.emph: Test at STI Switch Connection with Ignition Key ON

entry.para: < than 4.5V check connections, if 0V, check for open/short to ground in circuit 98.
< than 4.5V check connections, if 0V, check for open in ground circuit.

para.emph: If warning light does not turn on when key is turned ON

entry.para: 2. Disconnect (379) from ECM and install breakout box to harness. Jumper terminal 55 to ground and note if light is ON

item.para: If light is ON, the ECM is defective
If light does not turn ON, check circuit for open condition
If light goes off, ECM is defective

para.emph: IF warning light STAYS ON after self test

entry.para: 1. Check for active diagnostic trouble code conditions. (use EST or STI diagnostic trouble codes.)

item.para: If active diagnostic trouble codes are present, correct diagnostic trouble codes
If no diagnostic trouble codes are present, go to step 2

entry.para: 2. Disconnect (379) from ECM chassis connection and note if LIGHT remains ON

item.para: If light remains ON, check for short to ground in circuit

entry.para: Diagnostic Trouble Code 266 = Output Circuit Check detected during Standard Test, indicates high or low resistance in Warn Lamp circuit.

svcsubproc.title: Extended Description
svcsubproc.para: The STI switch (Engine Diagnostic Switch) can be used to run the Key-On Engine-Off (KOEO) Standard Tests. Diagnostic Trouble Codes detected during this test result in active Diagnostic Trouble Codes, which are transmitted as a series of flashes through the engine WARN ENGINE lamp. If no Diagnostic Trouble Codes are detected, the ECM will FLASH Diagnostic Trouble Code 111 (this indicates that no Diagnostic Trouble Codes have been detected).
Depressing the STI switch while turning the key ON starts the test cycle. The KOEO Standard tests include: (1) ECM Internal Tests and (2) Output Circuit Check (OCC) tests.
The normally open (N.O.) switch has one pole connected through circuit 98 to the ECM STI pin 34. The other switch pole is connected (circuit 98-G/11-GA) to the G2 ground stud.
ECM pin 34 has 5V with the key ON and engine OFF. Depressing the STI switch grounds pin 34, causing it to change from 5V to 0V, signaling the ECM to start the KOEO Standard Tests.

When the key switch is turned ON, the amber Engine Warning Light turns ON and stays ON while the ECM runs normal start-up tests, and then turns OFF. If the ECM detects a problem, the WARN ENGINE lamp remains on.

See Self Test Input Switch and Engine Warning Light Circuit Diagram
for the following discussion.

Ignition power WARN ENGINE is applied to the EWL. The ground side of the WARN ENGINE lamp is connected to ECM pin 55, which is a ground switch. The ECM applies 12V to terminal Pin 55 (light OFF) or 0V (light ON), in response to engine conditions.
There are no ECM diagnostics for the STI or Warning Light circuits.

step1.para: Before troubleshooting, make sure that the batteries are fully charged. Check battery connections and grounds for clean, tight damage free connections. Voltage tests will give misleading results if the batteries are not fully charged.

Before troubleshooting, inspect circuit connectors for pushed back, loose, or damaged (spread or bent) terminals, or wires with cut strands. Wires and connections must be free of damage or corrosion. When some connectors corrode, a light white residue will be present that must be removed.
Before troubleshooting, inspect suspect circuit grounds for clean, tight connections free of damage.

svcsubproc.para:
See Engine Warning Lights/Alarm and Test Switch Circuit Diagram
.
